examples: She achieved great success at a young age.
She had already achieved success beyond her wildest dreams.
The tennis player achieved a clean sweep of her matches, winning every set and advancing to the finals.
He achieved success by ruthlessly running roughshod over anyone who got in his way.
Some vegan cheeses use algae-based ingredients to achieve a creamy texture and unique flavor.
words.defineEn: to finally get the desired goal after dealing with many difficulties
words.defineVi: để cuối cùng có được mục tiêu mong muốn sau khi đối phó với nhiều khó khăn

examples: He made a false claim about his achievements to impress others.
She reached a high score on the exam and was proud of her achievement.
Being the Benjamin of the family, Sarah is constantly compared to her older siblings and their achievements.
Although they struggled to make ends meet, the Johnsons took pride in their children's academic achievements and aspirations.
Villa have punched above their weight all season and it will be a remarkable achievement if they finish fifth.
words.defineEn: the process or act of achieving something
words.defineVi: quá trình hoặc hành động để đạt được một cái gì đó

examples: Adults were also at risk from epidemics.
The child's cry of fear alerted the adults to the presence of a spider.
The child will become an adult.
Adults have the freedom to make their own decisions and choices.
As an adult, she took on the responsibilities of her career and family.
words.defineEn: a fully grown man or woman
words.defineVi: một người đàn ông hoặc phụ nữ trưởng thành hoàn toàn

examples: For Erikson, after young adulthood came the middle adulthood of our 40s to 60s.
So calves can grow to the size of a Boeing 757 by adulthood.
This disorder usually starts in the teenage years to early adulthood.
You reach adulthood and become busy with work, university, romance, kids, and Netflix.
For Erikson, after young adulthood came the middle adulthood of our 40s to 60s.
words.defineEn: the state or period of being an adult
words.defineVi: trạng thái hoặc thời kỳ trưởng thành

examples: The ocean's blue color amazed us.
Which just amazes people.
It amazes me that there's so much focus on Kansas.
In the Olympic Games, Fosbury amazed the world with his new technique, winning a gold metal with an Olympic record leap of 2.24 meters.
And it literally amazes me they don't understand that.
words.defineEn: to greatly surprise someone
words.defineVi: để rất ngạc nhiên ai đó

examples: The magician brought the house down with their amazing tricks, leaving the audience gasping in amazement.
In Israel, Netanyahu expressed amazement at what Obama had done.
I always watch this in such amazement.
I was so hurt by her amazement that tears came to my eyes.

When he fell, I think the amazement of Mubarak and his people that America deserted them openly, and the amazement of many allies of America, leaders in the region, that America seemed not to be a reliable ally and pushes you when they need at least not to interfere.
words.defineEn: a feeling of extreme surprise or wonder
words.defineVi: một cảm giác cực kỳ ngạc nhiên hoặc ngạc nhiên

examples: People will also simply get bored.
I was bored.
I was bored.
- I'm bored.
I'm bored.
words.defineEn: tired and unhappy because there is nothing to do or because we are no longer interested in something
words.defineVi: mệt mỏi và không vui vì không có gì để làm hoặc vì chúng ta không còn hứng thú với điều gì đó

examples: Or die of boredom.
The opposite of that is boredom, where you have low challenges with the mid-range skills.
Is it just pure boredom?
Boredom with your routine task can also sink your spirit and your motivation.
And stress and boredom and loneliness affects the mind.
words.defineEn: the quality of being boring; the state of being bored
words.defineVi: chất lượng nhàm chán; tình trạng buồn chán

examples: My grandparents celebrated their sixtieth wedding anniversary.
The country celebrated its independence with a grand parade and fireworks.
Finally the couple may be celebrating a birthday, a wedding anniversary or some other red-letter day.
They celebrated their anniversary with a romantic seafood dinner at a waterfront restaurant
In January, we celebrate the start of the new year with fireworks and joy.
words.defineEn: to do something special such as dancing or drinking that shows one is happy for an event
words.defineVi: làm điều gì đó đặc biệt chẳng hạn như khiêu vũ hoặc uống rượu để cho thấy một người rất vui vì một sự kiện

examples: The wedding celebrations went like a dream.
He decorated a vanilla cake with colorful sprinkles for a festive celebration.
They cooked corned beef and cabbage for their St. Patrick's Day celebration.
My birthday is in January, so I start the year with a celebration.
She collected the tail fat from the butcher to make traditional candles for a special celebration.
words.defineEn: a social gathering or event held in honor of a person, thing, or achievement, often marked by feasting, music, and dancing
words.defineVi: một cuộc tụ họp xã hội hoặc sự kiện được tổ chức để vinh danh một người, sự vật hoặc thành tích, thường được đánh dấu bằng tiệc tùng, âm nhạc và khiêu vũ

examples: A curious sheep approached me and sniffed my hand.
Despite the danger, the explorers were curious about what lay beyond the mountains.
As frightened as I am to die, I'm also curious to know what it's like beyond the veil.
After being told not to read a particular book, Susan found herself more curious about it, as the forbidden fruit is the sweetest.
James is a bright and curious boy who loves exploring nature and asking questions.
words.defineEn: interested in learning and knowing about things
words.defineVi: thích học hỏi và biết về mọi thứ

examples: Curiosity killed the cat, but satisfaction brought it back.
You know what they say - curiosity killed the cat.
The pig greeted me with curiosity and approached the fence.
She scratched that itch of curiosity by exploring different cultures and traditions.
As a brilliant scientist, Dr. Johnson's daughter proves to be a chip off the old block, showing the same level of curiosity and dedication to scientific research.
words.defineEn: a strong wish to learn something or to know more about something
words.defineVi: một mong muốn mạnh mẽ để tìm hiểu một cái gì đó hoặc để biết thêm về một cái gì đó

examples: You may be disappointed when a rainy day puts the kibosh on your picnic plans.
The singer's live performance failed to be up to the mark, disappointing the audience who had high expectations.
If you're having Johnny in your mind I'm sorry to disappoint you.
As the saying goes, expect disappointment and you will never be disappointed.
We were disappointed, to say the least, but we decided to put it behind us and get on with the project.
words.defineEn: to feel sad because something that one hoped for did not happen or was not what one expected; to make someone feel like this
words.defineVi: cảm thấy buồn vì điều gì đó mà người ta hy vọng đã không xảy ra hoặc không như người ta mong đợi; để làm cho ai đó cảm thấy như thế này

examples: The boy's disappointment was thinly veiled when he opened his present.
As the saying goes, expect disappointment and you will never be disappointed.
As a parent, I try not to shield my children from every disappointment.
Personal failures, disconnect from friends, and academic disappointments casted a cloud on my sense of purpose.
I've had my fair share of heartbreak and disappointment, but I still believe that there is more pleasure in loving than in being beloved - it's a risk worth taking.
words.defineEn: dissatisfaction that is resulted from the unfulfillment of one's expectations
words.defineVi: sự không hài lòng là kết quả của việc không đáp ứng mong đợi của một người

examples: She picked up the globe artichoke from the market, excited to try a new recipe.
We gathered elderberries, excited to use the aggregate fruits for making jams and pies.
It doesn't particularly excite her.
When hiking in areas with wildlife, it's important to remain quiet and avoid making sudden movements, as the bleating of the kid can excite the tiger
The ghost kitchen world excites me.
words.defineEn: to make a person feel eager, interested, or happy, particularly about something that will happen soon
words.defineVi: để làm cho một người cảm thấy háo hức, quan tâm, hoặc hạnh phúc, đặc biệt là về một cái gì đó sẽ xảy ra sớm

examples: The drug produces a feeling of excitement.
The child jumped up and down with excitement.
The crowd erupted into cries of excitement when their favorite band took the stage.
He learned to check his excitement.
Excitement was coursing through her blood ever more fiercely as she got closer to seeing her sister.
words.defineEn: a feeling of much enthusiasm and happiness
words.defineVi: một cảm giác rất nhiệt tình và hạnh phúc

examples: Everything was free
The museum has free admission on Fridays.
Nothing in life is free, no penny, no paternoster.
The press as always gave him a free pass as with so many other issues.
The country is holding its first free elections for 20 years.
words.defineEn: not requiring payment
words.defineVi: không yêu cầu thanh toán

examples: She prefers the freedom and agility of a motorcycle over a car.
Adults have the freedom to make their own decisions and choices.
The west is often associated with notions of freedom and adventure.
He's enjoying his newfound freedom by going out with friends and pursuing his hobbies.
The teacher ruled the classroom with a heavy hand, rarely allowing any freedom or creativity.
words.defineEn: the right to act, say, or think as one sees fit without being stopped, controlled, or restricted
words.defineVi: quyền hành động, nói hoặc suy nghĩ khi một người thấy phù hợp mà không bị ngăn chặn, kiểm soát hoặc hạn chế

examples: Friends shared a platter of crispy chicken wings with tangy dipping sauces at the sports bar.
The new student quickly made friends with the other musicians, because birds of a feather flock together.
My friends enjoyed tangy barbecue gammon skewers at the summer barbecue.
My friend prefers a vegetarian sandwich with avocado and sprouts.
My friends enjoyed smoky beef rib chops at the countryside barbecue.
words.defineEn: someone we know well, like a lot, and trust, but normally they are not part of our family
words.defineVi: một người mà chúng ta biết rõ, rất thích và tin tưởng, nhưng thông thường họ không phải là một phần của gia đình chúng ta

examples: Your friendship means a great deal to me.
By degrees their business relationship grew into friendship.
It didn't change their friendship, but it made Mark appreciate Alex's openness and authenticity.
The misunderstanding between the two friends was blown out of proportion, painting their friendship in a bad light.
His constant lateness was really starting to eat into their friendship.
words.defineEn: a relationship between friends; the state of being friends
words.defineVi: một mối quan hệ giữa những người bạn; trạng thái là bạn bè

examples: He was frustrated that his friends weren't helping him with his job search.
Frustrated with the congestion, he started elbowing through the packed hallway to reach the exit.
Elizabeth feels frustrated when people assume she's unhappy because she's on the shelf.
The family of the victim was frustrated by the slow progress of the trial, feeling that justice delayed is justice denied.
After failing to secure investors for his startup, Derek was frustrated but determined to learn from his mistakes.
words.defineEn: to prevent someone from achieving success, particularly by nullifying their efforts
words.defineVi: để ngăn cản ai đó đạt được thành công, đặc biệt là bằng cách vô hiệu hóa những nỗ lực của họ

examples: The Youtube comment sowed a seed of anger and untold frustrations which brought some questions to the forefront of her mind.
He expresses frustration.
That frustration has fueled protests.
We understand your frustration.
So I get the frustration.
words.defineEn: the feeling of being impatient, annoyed, or upset because of being unable to do or achieve what is desired
words.defineVi: cảm giác thiếu kiên nhẫn, khó chịu hoặc buồn bã vì không thể làm hoặc đạt được những gì mong muốn

examples: The chef sprinkled a generous amount of roe on the dish.
The full English breakfast included a generous portion of black pudding alongside eggs, bacon, and beans.
He poured a generous amount of treacle over his warm pancakes
They sprinkled a generous amount of caraway seeds over their roasted vegetables.
He spread a generous amount of tartar sauce on his fish sandwich.
words.defineEn: showing a willingness or willing to freely give money, spend time, etc. with others
words.defineVi: thể hiện sự sẵn lòng hoặc sẵn sàng tự do cho tiền, dành thời gian, v.v. với người khác

examples: Mary's kindness and generosity towards others has earned her love and respect from everyone she meets.
We are so thankful for their kindness and generosity and we promise to pay it forward.
I try to remind my kids that they mustn't take the generosity of their grandparents for granted.
"The good die young," said the pastor sadly at Robert's funeral, for even at the age of 80, his kindness, faith and generosity made his passing feel far too soon.
But that rationality also included generosity.
words.defineEn: the quality of being kind, understanding and unselfish, especially in providing money or gifts to others
words.defineVi: phẩm chất tốt bụng, hiểu biết và không ích kỷ, đặc biệt là trong việc cung cấp tiền hoặc quà tặng cho người khác

examples: I'm happy to get a little more bang for my bucks.
As they say, a happy heart is better than a full purse.
Since she moved to a smaller apartment, my mother is as happy as a flea in a doghouse!
With his new job and his new car, Andy is a happy camper.
After their break-up, she was happy to see the back of her ex-boyfriend.
words.defineEn: emotionally feeling good
words.defineVi: cảm xúc tốt

examples: Money can't buy happiness.
She wore a true smile, showing her genuine happiness.
The wealthy businessman realized too late that a contented mind is a perpetual feast, and that money couldn't buy him true happiness.
She could not contain her happiness when meeting her childhood idol, and smiled from ear to ear the entire time.
Joe was tired of relying on others for his happiness.
words.defineEn: the feeling of being happy and well
words.defineVi: cảm giác hạnh phúc và tốt

examples: A work ill done must be twice done.
Remember that an ill wound is cured, not an ill name.
It is ill jesting with edged tools.
When the teacher fell ill, the substitute had to step into the breach and take over the class.
Remember that an ill wound is cured, not an ill name.
words.defineEn: not in a fine mental or physical state
words.defineVi: không ở trạng thái tinh thần hoặc thể chất tốt

examples: Regular exercise and healthy eating habits can prevent many illnesses as prevention is better than cure.
We never spoke about her illness.
You may find your illness hard to accept.
Emily had just recovered from her illness and was now in the pink of health.
The doctor examined her body to check for any signs of illness or injury.
words.defineEn: the state of being physically or mentally ill; a period of sickness or disease
words.defineVi: tình trạng bị bệnh về thể chất hoặc tinh thần; một thời kỳ ốm đau hoặc bệnh tật

examples: She imagined a sunny day at the beach, enjoying a scoop of lemon curd ice cream.
Imagine two criminals, partners in crime, who are arrested and placed in separate cells with no means of communication.
She imagined kids making funny faces after trying scorzonera for the first time.
She imagined a magical land where the trees were made of cotton candy and the rivers flowed with white sugar.
He imagines himself as a chef, creating a masterpiece dish with Calabrese as the star ingredient.
words.defineEn: to make or have an image of something in our mind
words.defineVi: để thực hiện hoặc có một hình ảnh của một cái gì đó trong tâm trí của chúng tôi

examples: By no stretch of the imagination does the factory operate efficiently.
I do not know what the interpreter said, but under no circumstances did I mean that I had a problem with you, not by any stretch of the imagination.
So comic books gave me an imagination.
Use your imagination.
Over the next century, gold mining captured people's imagination, during the great US gold rush.
words.defineEn: something that is formed in the mind and does not exist in reality
words.defineVi: một cái gì đó được hình thành trong tâm trí và không tồn tại trong thực tế

examples: The performance improved as their confidence grew.
The economy is improving, but the other side of the coin is that inflation is becoming a bigger problem.
Swimming helps to improve our cardiovascular fitness.
The engineer designs cars and improves their performance.
She practices the piano every day to improve her skills.
words.defineEn: to make a person or thing better
words.defineVi: để làm cho một người hoặc điều tốt hơn

examples: You're an improvement over last one.
Since the recent improvements to the service, the buses are running like clockwork.
The athlete learned that envy never enriched any man, so he focused on his own training and improvement instead of being jealous of his competitors.
The two sides have been at daggers drawn for some months now with no sign of improvement in relations.
If the proposal is rejected, we'll need to lick our wounds, gather feedback, and make improvements before submitting again.
words.defineEn: the action or process of making something better or becoming better
words.defineVi: hành động hoặc quá trình làm cho một cái gì đó tốt hơn hoặc trở nên tốt hơn

examples: The companies are two of a kind.
Thank you, you're very kind.
My aunt is a really kind sister to my father.
Thank you for your kind words, they made my day.
The lost child was helped by a kind police officer to find their way home.
words.defineEn: friendly and nice to others; caring about other people's feelings
words.defineVi: thân thiện và dễ mến với người khác; quan tâm đến cảm xúc của người khác

examples: Her intelligence and kindness make her the perfect girlfriend.
Her actions reflect her kindness and compassion towards others.
Mary's kindness and generosity towards others has earned her love and respect from everyone she meets.
A little bit of kindness can go a long way in brightening someone's day.
We are so thankful for their kindness and generosity and we promise to pay it forward.
words.defineEn: an action that is caring, kind, or helpful
words.defineVi: một hành động quan tâm, tử tế, hoặc hữu ích

examples: In 2018 the party had 10 000 members.
All members of the band equally share the band's profits.
In the wake of the scandal, several committee members resigned.
The company's recent collapse has left their pension fund members up the creek.
The members of the band are like peas in a pod.
words.defineEn: someone or something that is in a specific group, club, or organization
words.defineVi: ai đó hoặc cái gì đó trong một nhóm, câu lạc bộ hoặc tổ chức cụ thể

examples: How have you tested the waters before starting a membership site?
The membership costs $40 per month.
Instead, Costco's profits come from its memberships.
The premium membership gives you unlimited access for only $10 a month.
Its basic membership is $10 dollars a month, well below the industry standard of $71 dollars.
words.defineEn: the state of belonging to a group, organization, etc.
words.defineVi: trạng thái thuộc về một nhóm, tổ chức, v.v.

examples: The neighbors next door have a cat-and-dog life.
He often helps his neighbors with their chores.
Her cries brought the neighbors running.
My neighbor has a big black dog named Max.
He gifted a jar of homemade butterscotch sauce to his neighbor.
words.defineEn: someone who is living next to us or somewhere very close to us
words.defineVi: một người đang sống bên cạnh chúng tôi hoặc một nơi nào đó rất gần với chúng tôi

examples: Surprisingly, the quiet neighborhood came alive with vibrant festivities during the annual festival.
The constant noise from the construction site vexed the residents of the neighborhood.
She proudly served a fat hen-infused pesto at the neighborhood potluck.
She discovered a new café in the neighborhood.
Buying a house in this neighborhood is a smart move.
words.defineEn: the area around someone or somewhere
words.defineVi: khu vực xung quanh một ai đó hoặc một nơi nào đó

examples: His partner left the table in a fit of pique.
The diamond thief double-crossed his partners and gave them only worthless fake jewels.
We're really more like partners.
Ach partner is entitled to share in the profits of the business.
His business partner is holding the fort while he is away.
words.defineEn: the person that you are married to or having a romantic relationship with
words.defineVi: người mà bạn đã kết hôn hoặc có một mối quan hệ lãng mạn với

examples: The business partnership had started out promising, but from the sweetest wine, the tartest vinegar - it ended in a messy legal battle.
They have committed to a lifetime of love and partnership by getting married.
I had to end my partnership with my friend, but it was better one house spoiled than two - if we had continued to work together, it would have ruined our friendship and our business.
This helped them avoid misunderstandings and build a strong business partnership.
The two rival companies decided to put their differences aside and play ball to develop a mutually beneficial partnership.
words.defineEn: the state of being partners in a business
words.defineVi: trạng thái là đối tác trong một doanh nghiệp

examples: It is possible that parents have lost sight of their children as a result of their own problems.
It is possible to go without food for a few days.
Sorry, it's not possible to lend you my car.
The CEO is meeting her opposite number at Fukuda Electronics to discuss a possible joint venture.
I think it's possible to find a balance, you know?
words.defineEn: able to exist, happen, or be done
words.defineVi: có thể tồn tại, xảy ra, hoặc được thực hiện

examples: We are considering various possibilities.
Support the possibility of keeping a lid on tax increases.
The morning is a time of new beginnings and possibilities.
Moving to London is certainly a possibility - I wouldn't dismiss it out of hand.
Don't worry about the possibility of getting a flat tire on your road trip, never trouble trouble till trouble troubles you.
words.defineEn: the quality of having the capacity to improve, succeed, or develop into something in the future
words.defineVi: chất lượng có khả năng cải thiện, thành công hoặc phát triển thành một cái gì đó trong tương lai

examples: We are on the threshold of a new era in global relations.
She was charged in relation to a hit and run after she allegedly left the scene of an accident.
The two sides have been at daggers drawn for some months now with no sign of improvement in relations.
Relations with yourself, relationships with others, and improving those.
Nine of the Pan American neighbors severed diplomatic relations with the Axis, Colombia, Bolivia, Brazil, Ecuador, Mexico, Paraguay, Peru, Uruguay and Venezuela. -
words.defineEn: the way two or multiple things or people are connected
words.defineVi: cách hai hoặc nhiều thứ hoặc con người được kết nối

examples: Every relationship has a lot of ups and downs.
The siblings' relationship was a cat-and-dog life.
A stable relationship stands the test of time.
Evidence of their relationship exists in the form of a series of letters.
It puts a damper on our relationship.
words.defineEn: the connection among two or more things or people or the way in which they are connected
words.defineVi: sự kết nối giữa hai hoặc nhiều thứ hoặc con người hoặc cách thức mà chúng được kết nối

examples: Oh yeah, that was sad.
That's pretty sad if you ask me.
Sad, woe is us, to come to this plight!
She would cry at the drop of a hat when watching sad movies.
It would be humorous if it weren't so sad the way Sarah tiptoes around her wife.
words.defineEn: emotionally feeling bad
words.defineVi: cảm xúc tồi tệ

examples: When she looked into his eyes, she could see the pain and sadness that he was trying so hard to hide.
Never mention rope in the house of a man who has been hanged, as it brings nothing but sadness and sorrow.
Sadness is an ephemeral reaction to something.
I had more sadness.
Ancient Greek doctors didn't view sadness that way.
words.defineEn: the feeling of being sad and not happy
words.defineVi: cảm giác buồn và không vui

examples: People were tempted into the trade by the thought of easy money.
It's true what they say - an open door may tempt a saint.
One of my colleagues was rude to me in a meeting, and I was tempted to snap back.
Sadly, new customers are being enticed by tempting promotions only to find the dice are loaded against them.
Sarah's family was tempted to take out a loan to go on a lavish vacation, but they remembered the saying 'better go to bed supperless than rise in debt.'
words.defineEn: to feel the desire to do something
words.defineVi: để cảm thấy mong muốn để làm một cái gì đó

examples: The kids couldn't resist the temptation of the bowl filled with plump and juicy sweet cherries.
I can't resist the temptation of a loganberry muffin fresh out of the oven.
I couldn't resist the temptation of buying a bag of seedless tangerines.
As a meat lover, he couldn't resist the temptation of a tender beef roast, seasoned with herbs and spices.
I couldn't resist the temptation and licked my fingers after touching the powdered sugar on the donuts.
words.defineEn: the wish to do or have something, especially something improper or foolish
words.defineVi: mong muốn làm hoặc có một cái gì đó, đặc biệt là một cái gì đó không đúng hoặc ngu ngốc

examples: but she's wise beyond her years.
The wise owls went to visit their grand kids in their scooters.
Don't be penny-wise, Hawthorne.
We're all penny wise these days.
Our wise man of Gotham is yet to arrive.
words.defineEn: knowledgeable and experienced and therefore able to give good advice or make good decisions
words.defineVi: hiểu biết và có kinh nghiệm và do đó có thể đưa ra lời khuyên tốt hoặc đưa ra quyết định tốt

examples: Thanks for the pearl of wisdom, buddy, but your suggestion is ridiculous.
She cherished the wisdom and experience that came with being old.
James, in the vale of his years, reflects on his life's journey and the wisdom he has gained along the way.
She presented an abstract idea that challenged conventional wisdom and sparked a lively debate.
The wrinkles and gray hair show that he's getting on, but he's still full of wisdom and experience.
words.defineEn: the quality of being knowledgeable, experienced, and able to make good decisions and judgments
words.defineVi: phẩm chất của kiến thức, kinh nghiệm, và có thể đưa ra quyết định và đánh giá tốt
